meanings.definition: The transportation of goods or people by aircraft.
meanings.sent1: During the war, the soldiers organized an airlift to deliver supplies to the troops.
meanings.sent2: The humanitarian organization arranged an airlift to send aid to the disaster-stricken area.
meanings.sent3: The airlift of birthday presents to the remote village made the children very happy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an airlift of joy that lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The successful airlift of medical supplies saved many lives in the remote region.

meanings.definition: To transport goods or people by aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The rescue team had to airlift the injured hiker to safety from the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The company decided to airlift the new product to meet the urgent demand.
meanings.sent3: They had to airlift the giant cake for the party because it was too big for the car.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to airlift his spirits and bring a smile to his face.
meanings.sent5: The helicopter airlifted the stranded climbers to the base camp, saving them from the storm.

meanings.definition: An operation to transport goods or people by aircraft.
meanings.sent1: The government launched an airlift to evacuate citizens from the conflict zone.
meanings.sent2: The airlift of supplies to the remote island was a challenging but successful mission.
meanings.sent3: The surprise airlift of ice cream to the school delighted all the students.
meanings.sent4: The airlift of hope brought a sense of relief to the stranded travelers.
meanings.sent5: The massive airlift of equipment was crucial for the construction project in the mountainous region.
